guide.conclusion: That's it! All you need is a computer and internet to install the Arduino programming software (of course, if you want to program anything, you need a USB connector and an Arduino as well).

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: First, you need to direct yourself to the Arduino site. Open your web browser and enter this URL: www.arduino.cc/
lines.text_raw: First, you need to direct yourself to the Arduino site. Open your web browser and enter this URL: www.arduino.cc/

lines.text: Click "Search", or press the Enter button on your keyboard.
lines.text_raw: Click "Search", or press the Enter button on your keyboard.

lines.text: The Arduino home page should have appeared. Click the download button, shown in a red box in the picture.
lines.text_raw: The Arduino home page should have appeared. Click the download button, shown in a red box in the picture.

lines.text: You will be taken to the download page. Under "Download" (shown inside a red box in the image), there is a list of options for what systems you can install the software on. Since I have a Mac OS X, I chose the Mac OS X option.
lines.text_raw: You will be taken to the download page. Under "Download" (shown inside a red box in the image), there is a list of options for what systems you can install the software on. Since I have a Mac OS X, I chose the Mac OS X option.

lines.text: Once you click on the correct option, the download should automatically start. It usually takes a little more than a minute to load.
lines.text_raw: Once you click on the correct option, the download should automatically start. It usually takes a little more than a minute to load.

lines.text: Once it finishes loading, you need to decompress the .zip file. On Macs, it does this automatically, but on other systems the method varies.
lines.text_raw: Once it finishes loading, you need to decompress the .zip file. On Macs, it does this automatically, but on other systems the method varies.

lines.text: For Windows, right-click the file and then click "Extract" on the shortcut menu.
lines.text_raw: For Windows, right-click the file and then click "Extract" on the shortcut menu.

lines.text: Linux is much more complicated. Once you download the file you must click Application > System Tools > Terminal, which will open the terminal window. Once in Terminal, enter this text if you are a root user (you will see the "<tt>#</tt>" prompt): <tt>apt-get install unzip</tt>. If you are a Red Hat Linux/Fedora user, enter this in Terminal: <tt>yum install unzip</tt>.
lines.text_raw: Linux is much more complicated. Once you download the file you must click Application > System Tools > Terminal, which will open the terminal window. Once in Terminal, enter this text if you are a root user (you will see the "``#``" prompt): ``apt-get install unzip``. If you are a Red Hat Linux/Fedora user, enter this in Terminal: ``yum install unzip``.

lines.text: Once the software is unzipped, open the folder and double-click on the Arduino icon. It should open the Arduino environment!
lines.text_raw: Once the software is unzipped, open the folder and double-click on the Arduino icon. It should open the Arduino environment!

lines.text: One last comment: To start programming, you need to select the board you are using by clicking Tools > Board, and then choose the serial port by clicking Tools > Serial Port.
lines.text_raw: One last comment: To start programming, you need to select the board you are using by clicking Tools > Board, and then choose the serial port by clicking Tools > Serial Port.

lines.text: And that's it! You've downloaded the Arduino environment! Have fun!
lines.text_raw: And that's it! You've downloaded the Arduino environment! Have fun!

guide.summary: In this guide, you will learn how to install the Arduino environment. You can do this on any computer that has access to the internet!
